items.question: How long before Blood and Sand does this take place?
items.answer: This miniseries takes place roughly 5 years before Spartacus' enslavement.

items.question: Should I see this before Spartacus: Blood and Sand, Vengeance or War Of The Damned?
items.answer: It's recommended you watch them in the order they aired:Spartacus: Blood and SandSpartacus: Gods of the ArenaSpartacus: VengeanceSpartacus: War of the DamnedWhile this miniseries is a prequel to Blood and Sand, the very beginning and very end of Gods of the Arena spoil the ending to Blood and Sand. Also, there are some characters and plot developments that stem from Gods of the Arena in Vengeance. So it's recommended you watch this miniseries before Vengeance to understand them. However, if you are re-watching, it's quite enjoyable to watch GotA first.

items.question: Will there be a second season?
items.answer: For Spartacus: Gods Of The Arena, no.This was a six episode prequel season to the first season of Spartacus: Blood And Sand. A second and third season of Blood and Sand has finished airing and they are titled "Spartacus: Vengeance" and "Spartacus: War Of The Damned" respectively. WotD is the final season of the series.

items.question: What are the differences between the TV Versions and the Blu-ray Versions?
items.answer: Like "Spartacus: Blood and Sand", Extended Version were released on Blu-ray that feature more violence, nudity and also extended plot sequences that are missing in the TV versions.
